author: .paulharris
content:
There was a thing re. eIP-6110 / 7285, where all deposits go through pending deposits queue...
does this then remove the volatility of validator indices that EIP-6110 introduced initially? or are we still in a position of not guaranteeing non finalized validator indices?

author: m.kalinin
content:
During the Nyota on the workshop we had a rough consensus on that we want to queue deposits for rate limiting purposes, and we can finalize them before applying -- low complexity if we already have the queue. Details are here: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/3689#issuecomment-2112987260

I am looking at speccing out those things that we were discussing during the workshop right now. There is a big-deposit-test with 1000 deposits, https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/3689#issuecomment-2117480097. It would be great if more clients run it to understand how bad is verifying 1000 sigs during block processing.

author: .paulharris
content: hrm ok , so depending on that we might be able to avoid having to have a weird cache for these poorly defined validator indices...
